fields.text:
Connect Fitbit
If you see "Connect Fitbit" next to "Yesterday's Active Minutes" you need to connect your Fitbit to our site. Click on the "Connect Fitbit" link and enter your Fitbit account information. On the following screen check "Allow All" and then press the Allow button. We collect the number of minutes you sleep, the number of minutes you exercise, and information about your heart rate. We will not be able to see your password or otherwise access your account directly.

Zone Minutes
You will register Zone Minutes for time spent in the "Fat Burn", "Cardio", and "Peak" heart-rate zones as shown on your Fitbit App. You will register two Zone Minutes for each minute you are in the "Cardio" or "Peak" zones. You will register one Zone Minute for each minute you spend in the "Fat Burn" zone.

Heart Health Score
Your heart health score ranges from 0 - 100. The more exercise your Fitbit records each day, the higher your score will rise the following day.

Maintenance Minutes
These are the number of active minutes your Fitbit must record today to keep your heart health score the same tomorrow.

Improvement Minutes
These are the number of active minutes your Fitbit must record today to improve your heart health score to the specified amount tomorrow.

Graph
The horizontal axis shows today's range of active minutes your Fitbit could record. The vertical axis shows how your heart score will change tomorrow based on the number of active minutes you have today. Notice that being a little more active today might increase your heart score by a little, or at certain activity levels, it might increase it by a lot.

Connect Fitbit
If you see "Connect Fitbit" next to "Yesterday's Hours Sleeping" you need to connect your Fitbit to our site. Click on the "Connect Fitbit" link and enter your Fitbit account information. On the following screen check "Allow All" and then press the Allow button. We will only be collecting the number of minutes you sleep and the number of minutes you exercise. We will not be able to see your password or otherwise access your account directly.

Sleep Health Score
Your sleep health score ranges from 0 - 100. The more sleep your Fitbit records each day, the higher your score will rise the following day.

Maintenance Hours
These are the number of hours of sleep your Fitbit must record today to keep your sleep health score the same tomorrow.

Improvement Hours
These are the number of hours of sleep your Fitbit must record today to improve your sleep health score to the specified amount tomorrow.

Graph
The horizontal axis shows today's range of sleep hours your Fitbit could record. The vertical axis shows how your sleep score will change tomorrow based on the amount of sleep you get today. Notice that getting a little bit more sleep today might increase your sleep score by a little, or at certain sleep levels, it might increase it by a lot.

Daily Payment
  • You receive a fixed payment for checking in every day. This is not affected by your exercise or sleep activity. If you fail to check-in on any given day you will not be paid for that day.
Wrist Time
  • You must keep the Fitbit on your wrist for the specified amount of time each day. If the Fitbit does not register the required wrist time on a given day, you will not be paid on the following day.
Notes
  • You must visit the site each day and verify that your activity minutes match what your Fitbit app shows for yesterday. Press the refresh button in the top-right if yesterday's date is still displayed.
  • You must press the Pay Me button to get paid each day, payments are sent via PayPal to your email address.

Connect Fitbit
If you see "Connect Fitbit" next to "Yesterday's Active Minutes" you need to connect your Fitbit to our site. Click on the "Connect Fitbit" link and enter your Fitbit account information. On the following screen check "Allow All" and then press the Allow button. We collect the number of minutes you sleep, the number of minutes you exercise, and information about your heart rate. We will not be able to see your password or otherwise access your account directly.

Zone Minutes
You will register Zone Minutes for time spent in the "Fat Burn", "Cardio", and "Peak" heart-rate zones as shown on your Fitbit App. You will register two Zone Minutes for each minute you are in the "Cardio" or "Peak" zones. You will register one Zone Minute for each minute you spend in the "Fat Burn" zone.

Heart Health Score
Your heart health score ranges from 0 - 100. The more exercise your Fitbit records each day, the higher your score will rise the following day.

Maintenance Minutes
These are the number of active minutes your Fitbit must record today to keep your heart health score the same tomorrow.

Improvement Minutes
These are the number of active minutes your Fitbit must record today to improve your heart health score to the specified amount tomorrow.

Graph
The horizontal axis shows today's range of active minutes your Fitbit could record. The vertical axis shows how your heart score will change tomorrow based on the number of active minutes you have today. Notice that being a little more active today might increase your heart score by a little, or at certain activity levels, it might increase it by a lot.

Connect Fitbit
If you see "Connect Fitbit" next to "Yesterday's Hours Sleeping" you need to connect your Fitbit to our site. Click on the "Connect Fitbit" link and enter your Fitbit account information. On the following screen check "Allow All" and then press the Allow button. We will only be collecting the number of minutes you sleep and the number of minutes you exercise. We will not be able to see your password or otherwise access your account directly.

Sleep Health Score
Your sleep health score ranges from 0 - 100. The more sleep your Fitbit records each day, the higher your score will rise the following day.

Maintenance Hours
These are the number of hours of sleep your Fitbit must record today to keep your sleep health score the same tomorrow.

Improvement Hours
These are the number of hours of sleep your Fitbit must record today to improve your sleep health score to the specified amount tomorrow.

Graph
The horizontal axis shows today's range of sleep hours your Fitbit could record. The vertical axis shows how your sleep score will change tomorrow based on the amount of sleep you get today. Notice that getting a little bit more sleep today might increase your sleep score by a little, or at certain sleep levels, it might increase it by a lot.

Daily Payment
Your daily payment is based on three components.:
  • The fixed payment is the amount of money you receive for checking in every day. This component is not affected by your exercise or sleep activity.
  • Heart pay is the amount of money you receive for doing daily exercise. For each heart point in your heart score, you will earn a heart payment. Your heart score cannot exceed 100.
  • Sleep pay is the amount of money you receive for sleeping each day. For each sleep point in your heart score, you will earn a heart payment. Your sleep score cannot exceed 100.
Wrist Time
  • You must keep the Fitbit on your wrist for the specified amount of time each day. If the Fitbit does not register the required wrist time on a given day, you will not be paid on the following day.
Notes
  • You must visit the site each day and verify that your activity minutes match what your Fitbit app shows for yesterday. Press the refresh button in the top-right if yesterday's date is still displayed.
  • You must press the Pay Me button to get paid each day, payments are sent via PayPal to your email address.
  • You will only be paid for activates recorded by the Fitbit tracker. Manually added activities will be ignored. It is your responsibility to make sure the Fitbit is recording accurately. We cannot pay you for activities the Fitbit tracker does not register.

Connect Fitbit
If you see "Connect Fitbit" next to "Yesterday's Active Minutes" you need to connect your Fitbit to our site. Click on the "Connect Fitbit" link and enter your Fitbit account information. Daily Payment
Your daily payment is based on three components.:
  • The fixed payment is the amount of money you receive for checking in every day. This component is not affected by your exercise or sleep activity.
  • Heart pay is the amount of money you receive for doing daily exercise. For each heart point in your heart score, you will earn a heart payment. Your heart score cannot exceed 100.
  • Sleep pay is the amount of money you receive for sleeping each day. For each sleep point in your heart score, you will earn a heart payment. Your sleep score cannot exceed 100.
Wrist Time
  • You must keep the Fitbit on your wrist for the specified amount of time each day. If the Fitbit does not register the required wrist time on a given day, you will not be paid on the following day.

  • You must visit the site each day and verify that your activity minutes match what your Fitbit app shows for yesterday. Press the refresh button in the top-right if yesterday's date is still displayed.
  • You must press the Pay Me button to get paid each day, payments are sent via PayPal to your email address.
  • You will only be paid for activates recorded by the Fitbit tracker. Manually added activities will be ignored. It is your responsibility to make sure the Fitbit is recording accurately. We cannot pay you for activities the Fitbit tracker does not register.

fields.title: Your activity payments will change in two days.
fields.text:
You will continue to earn $[fixed pay] for wearing your Fitbit and checking in each day.

Additionally,

You will earn $[heart pay] for each heart point you have per day.

You will earn $[immune pay] for each sleep point you have per day.

Tonight's hours asleep and tomorrow's active minutes will be paid at the above rate.

fields.title: Your activity payments have changed.
fields.text:
You will now earn $[heart pay] for each heart point you have per day.

You will now earn $[immune pay] for each sleep point you have per day.

You will continue to earn $[fixed pay] for wearing your Fitbit and checking in each day.

You may need to refresh your browser to see this change.
